coursework.leesja

Class CS2150Coursework

  • java.lang.Object
    • GraphicsLab.GraphicsLab
      • coursework.leesja.CS2150Coursework

  • public class CS2150Coursework
extends GraphicsLab.GraphicsLab
    Inspired by the Talos I station from the game Prey (2017), this scene features a space station orbiting the moon, with the moon orbiting the Earth and the Earth orbiting the Sun. All stellar bodies rotate on their own axis, and orientation and orbit are to scale (e.g. in the time it takes Earth to rotate once on its axis, the Moon will have completed 1/27.5 of its orbit around the Earth and 1/27 of its axial rotation). Talos I features functioning lights on its exterior and a rotating ring. Animations make use of the animation scale set by the main method.

    Controls:

    • Press the escape key to exit the application.
    • Hold the x, y and z keys to view the scene along the x, y and z axis, respectively
    • While viewing the scene along the x, y or z axis, use the up and down cursor keys to increase or decrease the viewpoint's distance from the scene origin
    • Press L to toggle the red lights on the station
    • Use LEFT and RIGHT arrow keys to rotate around the scene
    • Use UP and DOWN arrow keys to zoom in and out
    • Press SPACE to reset the animation

      • setSceneCamera

        protected void setSceneCamera()
        Description copied from class: GraphicsLab.GraphicsLab
        Sets default values for the sample's viewpoint and projection settings. This behaviour may be overriden by each sample to provide customised camera control; alternatively, deriving classes may call super.setSceneCamera and then provide custom camera position and orientation
        Overrides:
        setSceneCamera in class GraphicsLab.GraphicsLab

      • drawRotatingTexturedBody

        protected float drawRotatingTexturedBody(float radius,
                                         float orientation,
                                         float rotation,
                                         org.newdawn.slick.opengl.Texture texture)
        Draws a textured body (e.g. a planet) rotating on a vertical axis.
        Parameters:
        radius - radius of the body.
        orientation - current orientation of the body.
        rotation - angle to rotate by each frame (multiplied by animation scale)
        texture -
        Returns:
        new orientation of the body

      • drawUnitHull

        protected void drawUnitHull()
        Draw and set normals for each face of the main piece of the space station hull, a cuboid with bevelled edges. This is (mistakenly) size 2x2 (instead of 1x1), but this should make little difference. All vertex and face numbers correspond to a vertex and face on the design sketch.

      • drawUnitEndPiece

        protected void drawUnitEndPiece()
        Draw and set normals for the piece of station hull which attaches to the ends of the bevelled main piece. 2x2 in size, matching main piece. All vertex and face numbers correspond to a vertex and face on the design sketch.

      • drawStation

        protected void drawStation()
        Draw the space station: set relevant materials, set orientation and rotate, draw components and put them together

                                 float orientation)
        Draw a 3D rotating ring made up of quadrics
        Parameters:
        outer - radius of ring
        inner - radius of hole in ring
        orientation - current orientation of ring in 3D space
        Returns:
        new orientation of ring in 3D space
